log.input:
1. Screen Settings
Set the canvas width to 700 and height to 400. Please plot the trajectory of the ball. Do not change the size of the canvas.

2. Object Motion & Parameter Settings
Please create a VPython animation of a horizontally projected ball: Release a ball horizontally in mid-air, which then bounces off the ground.
Draw both the ball and the ground. Assume that the ball undergoes an elastic collision with the ground, considering only the effect of gravity, meaning the ball accelerates downward due to gravity and bounces upon hitting the ground. Stop the motion of the ball after 10 seconds.

3. Cyber Input Variable Mapping Information:

(1) Define and initialize a Cyber Input Variable named Speed_I with an initial value set at 1. This variable represents the speed of the ball.

(2) During the animation, whenever the value of the Speed_I variable changes, the speed of the moving ball should be immediately updated to the new value of Speed_I.

(3) Define and initialize a Cyber Input Variable named Gravity_I with an initial value set at 9.8. This variable represents the gravitational acceleration.

(4) During the animation, whenever the value of the Gravity_I variable changes, the gravitational acceleration should be immediately updated to the new value of Gravity_I.
(5) Do not import packages that are not supported by VPython such as numpy, math, sympy, scipy and time.
log.output:
from vpython import *

# Set the canvas
scene = canvas(width=700, height=400)

# Define and initialize Cyber Input Variables
Speed_I = 1
Gravity_I = 9.8

# Create ball and ground
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0,5,0), radius=0.5, color=color.red)
ground = box(pos=vector(0,-0.1/2,0), size=vector(10,0.1,10), color=color.green)

# Set initial velocity and acceleration due to gravity
ball.velocity = vector(Speed_I, 0, 0)
ball.accel = vector(0, -Gravity_I, 0)

# Time settings
t = 0
dt = 0.01

while t < 10:
    # Update speed and gravitational acceleration
    ball.velocity.x = Speed_I
    ball.accel.y = -Gravity_I

    # Update position and velocity
    ball.pos = ball.pos + ball.velocity*dt
    ball.velocity = ball.velocity + ball.accel*dt

    # Bounce when hit the ground
    if ball.pos.y < ball.radius:
        ball.velocity.y = -ball.velocity.y

    t = t + dt
    rate(100)
